tit.e: Iden (fields given according to the court rank)

sen.j: 位田（いでん）は、日本の律令制において、五位以上の有位者と有品の皇族へ位階・品位に応じて支給された田地である。
sen.e: Iden refers to rice fields which were given to people higher than goi (Fifth Rank) in the rank and Imperial families, depending on the rank or honi (court rank) in the ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code) in Japan.

Iden refers to the rice fields which were given to the ones higher than goi (Fifth Rank) in the rank and the imperial family, depending on the rank or honi (court rank) in the ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code) in Japan.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。people→the ones,Imperial families→the imperial family と修正しました。

sen.j: 租庸調の納税が義務づけられる輸租田とされていた。
sen.e: It was regarded as Yusoden (rice field subject to taxation) which was obliged to pay tax of Soyocho (a tax system, corvee).

sen.j: なお、品位に応じて支給された田地は品田（ほんでん）とも呼んだ。
sen.e: And the rice fields which were given depending on honi were also called honden (a rice field that was given based on one's official rank).

sen.j: 唐律令における官人永業田の制度が日本の国情に合わせて改変され、日本律令へ採用されたものと考えられる。
sen.e: Kanjin-eigyo-den (hereditary field of officials) system in Tang Ritsuryo Code was changed and improved for the situation in Japan and was applied to Japanese ritsuryo system.
Kanjin-eigyo-den (hereditary field of officials) system in Tang Ritsuryo Code was modified to be suitable for the situation in Japan and was applied to the Japanese ritsuryo system.
sen.cmt: changed and improved→modified と修正しました。to be suitable, the を補いました。
sen.e: Kanjin-eigyo-den (hereditary field of officials) system in Tang Ritsuryo Code was modified to be suitable for the situation in Japan and was applied to the Japanese ritsuryo system.

sen.j: 唐の官人永業田は子孫代々への継承が可能であったが、日本の位田は死後に収公された点で異なっている。
sen.e: Kanjin-eigyo-den in Tang Dynasty could be succeeded to offsprings for generations, but differently, iden in Japan were officially confiscated after death.
Kanjin-eigyo-den in Tang Dynasty could be succeeded to offspring for generations, but differently, iden in Japan were officially confiscated after ones' death.
sen.cmt: offsprings→offspring と修正しました。ones' を補いました。
sen.e: Kanjin-eigyo-den in Tang Dynasty could be succeeded to offspring for generations, but differently, iden in Japan were officially confiscated after ones' death.

sen.j: 位田の選定方法、位田の実際の耕作者などは、まだ解明されていない。
sen.e: The method of choice of iden, the actual cultivators of iden and so on have not been clarified yet.
